body: Hi! I read about the issue and I have seen the code. So all you are doing here  is classifying the different bugs from the list that have  fixed some commits. Classifying them in one go would require us to sort them first. What more insights can you provide me on this?

Hello! We don't need to sort them, we can classify them in any order.
You have an example classification of multiple items (commits in this case, but you can apply the same to bugs) here: https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/blob/4bd73121bb86afe3d9a045ad97aea9a92fc71e21/scripts/generate_landings_risk_report.py#L277.
Hey this is my first time on Github and I am looking for my first contribution. Can you please tell me, what will I need to do exactly in this request?

Hello @Abhishek5002443, the description of what needs to be done is above. First of all follow https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/issues/1092. Then, once everything is set-up, follow the pointers I gave above, try to understand that code, and then try to implement what was requested above. If you get stuck, feel free to ask questions.

issue.title: Classify multiple bugs at the same time #1866

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Hello there this is my first contribution.

I have modified the code to classify the bugs at the same time by appending them to a list.
I then iterate over that list and apply the same logic as before.

body: Hi I had a go fixing this issue, making the defect model classify in one go. Should the regression model also classify bugs at the same time?

> Hi I had a go fixing this issue, making the defect model classify in one go. Should the regression model also classify bugs at the same time?

If possible yes, can you file a new issue for that?

issue.title: Classify multiple defect bugs at a time in the code to find bug-fixing commits

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Following on from #1866.

When a bug is classified as a defect, it is then classified by the regression model one bug at a time in

https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/blob/1a584d62dc6c7f97f0e306596b45addefada8491/scripts/regressor_finder.py#L266

we could collect all the bugs that are classified as defect and classify them in one go.

Tested by running `python -m scripts.regressor_finder bug_fixing`

body:
> If possible yes, can you file a new issue for that?

Ok will do, created the new issue #2007 .
Hello everyone!, I have a little past experience with open source contribution. Can I work on this bug?
@5aumy4 please read the introduction first; there is already a PR open to fix this issue, so you'd need to choose another issue to work on.
